üìä Project Overview

üéØ SKOLARIS - Student Information System

SKOLARIS is a comprehensive Student Information System (SIS) designed specifically for ICCT Colleges multi-campus environment. It centralizes student data management from admissions to graduation, streamlining administrative processes and supporting institutional growth through data-driven decisions.

üèóÔ∏è System Architecture by Category

üìù Student Entry & Management

Complete student lifecycle from application to graduation

  • Admission & Enrollment - Online Application, Document Verification, Entrance Exam Management, Section Assignment, Enrollment Confirmation
  • Student Profile Management - Enrollment History, Academic Records, Personal Information, Parental & Guardian Information, Student ID Generation
  • Clearance & Graduation - Student Clearance Workflow, Graduation Eligibility, Diploma & Certificate Generation

üéì Academic Operations

Core academic processes and curriculum management

  • Curriculum & Class Scheduling - Program & Curriculum Management, Subject Catalog, Class Scheduling, Faculty Assignment
  • Grades & Transcript Management - Grade Encoding & Approval, Grade Viewing, Transcript of Records Generation, GPA/CGPA Calculation
  • Faculty & Staff Portal - Faculty Class Management, Advisory Functions, Grading Tools, Faculty Profile

üí∞ Financial Management

Comprehensive financial and payment processing

  • Assessment & Payment - Tuition Fee Assessment, Online Payment Integration, Scholarship & Discount Handling, Payment History
  • Financial Aid Tracking - Scholarships, discounts, payment plans
  • Financial Reporting - Revenue reports, payment analytics

üìä Analytics & Reporting

Data insights and comprehensive reporting system

  • Reports & Analytics - Enrollment Statistics, Financial Reports, Academic Performance Dashboards
  • Registrar Tools - Student Record Management, Reports Generation, User & Permission Control, Data Backup & Archive
  • Custom Dashboards - Role-based data visualization

üì± Digital Integration

Modern communication and learning integration

  • Mobile & Notification System - SMS / Email Alerts, Mobile App Integration, Push Notifications
  • LMS Integration - Blackboard / Moodle / Google Classroom Link, Grade Sync, Assignment Management
  • Communication Tools - Email integration, announcements

üîß System Administration

Multi-campus management and security features

  • Multi-Campus Support - Centralized management across 8 campuses
  • Role-Based Access Control - Granular permissions system
  • Audit & Security - Activity logging, security monitoring

üìä Database Overview

SKOLARIS uses a comprehensive relational database design with 45 tables organized into logical modules. The core architecture supports multi-campus operations with role-based access control, ensuring data integrity and scalability across all ICCT campuses. The system includes comprehensive Philippine student information management with DepEd compliance.

üîê Core Database Schema ERD

Database Structure High Priority

Database Schema ERD Diagram

Core Tables Relationship

üìã Core Database Schema Explanation

This ERD represents the foundational database structure for the SKOLARIS system, establishing the core relationships between campuses, users, roles, and permissions. The design follows a hierarchical multi-campus architecture that supports role-based access control (RBAC).

  • üè¢ CAMPUSES: Central entity managing multiple ICCT campus locations with unique identifiers and contact information
  • üë• USERS: Base user table linked to campuses, containing authentication and profile data for all system users
  • üîê ROLES: Defines 8 user roles (Super Admin, System Admin, Campus Admin, Registrar, Faculty, Staff, Student, Guest) with campus-specific or global scope
  • üîë PERMISSIONS: Granular permission system controlling access to specific modules and actions
  • üîó ROLE_PERMISSIONS: Many-to-many relationship mapping roles to their specific permissions
  • üë§ USER_ROLES: Junction table assigning roles to users within specific campus contexts

This schema ensures secure, scalable multi-campus management with fine-grained access control and data isolation between campuses.

üîó Core Schema Relationships
üè¢ ‚Üí üë• CAMPUSES to USERS

One-to-Many: Each campus can have multiple users, but each user belongs to exactly one campus. This ensures data isolation and campus-specific user management.

üè¢ ‚Üí üîê CAMPUSES to ROLES

One-to-Many: Each campus can define its own roles (campus-specific) or use global roles. Enables flexible role management per campus.

üîê ‚Üí üîë ROLES to PERMISSIONS

Many-to-Many: Through ROLE_PERMISSIONS junction table. Each role can have multiple permissions, and each permission can be assigned to multiple roles.

üë• ‚Üí üîê USERS to ROLES

Many-to-Many: Through USER_ROLES junction table. Users can have multiple roles within specific campus contexts, enabling flexible access control.

Database Schema - Entity Relationship Diagram
üè¢ CAMPUSES

campus_code
campus_name
address, phone, email
‚Üí
üë• USERS

‚Üí
üîê ROLES

üîë PERMISSIONS

module, action
resource, description
‚Üí
üîó ROLE_PERMISSIONS

‚Üí
üë§ USER_ROLES

campus_id (FK)

üéì Academic Module ERD Diagram

Academic ERD High Priority

Academic Module Entity Relationship Diagram

Student Academic Management Tables

üéì Academic Module Explanation

This ERD manages the complete academic lifecycle from student enrollment to graduation, including curriculum management, class scheduling, grade tracking, and transcript generation. The design supports flexible academic structures across multiple programs and campuses.

  • üë• STUDENTS: Student records linked to users and programs, tracking enrollment status and academic progress
  • üìö PROGRAMS: Academic programs offered by each campus with specific duration and requirements
  • üìñ CURRICULUM: Course mapping for programs, defining subject sequences, prerequisites, and credit units
  • üìù SUBJECTS: Master list of all courses with codes, names, units, and descriptions
  • üè´ SECTIONS: Class sections for each program year level with capacity limits
  • ‚è∞ CLASS_SCHEDULES: Detailed scheduling linking sections, subjects, rooms, and time slots
  • üìä STUDENT_GRADES: Grade tracking for each student-subject combination with multiple assessment types
  • üìú TRANSCRIPTS: Academic records summarizing student performance by semester and year
  • üè¢ ROOMS: Physical classroom and facility management for scheduling

This module ensures comprehensive academic management with flexible curriculum design, efficient scheduling, and accurate grade tracking across all programs and campuses.

üîó Academic Module Relationships
üë• ‚Üí üìö STUDENTS to PROGRAMS

Many-to-One: Each student belongs to one program, but each program can have multiple students. Links students to their academic track.

üìö ‚Üí üìñ PROGRAMS to CURRICULUM

One-to-Many: Each program has multiple curriculum entries defining required subjects, prerequisites, and academic sequences.

üìù ‚Üí üìñ SUBJECTS to CURRICULUM

One-to-Many: Each subject can be part of multiple curriculum entries across different programs and year levels.

üè´ ‚Üí ‚è∞ SECTIONS to CLASS_SCHEDULES

One-to-Many: Each section can have multiple class schedules for different subjects, days, and time slots.

üë• ‚Üí üìä STUDENTS to STUDENT_GRADES

One-to-Many: Each student can have multiple grade records for different subjects and academic periods.

üìù ‚Üí üìä SUBJECTS to STUDENT_GRADES

One-to-Many: Each subject can have multiple student grade records across different students and semesters.

üë• ‚Üí üìú STUDENTS to TRANSCRIPTS

One-to-Many: Each student can have multiple transcript records for different academic years and semesters.

üè¢ ‚Üí üè¢ ROOMS to CLASS_SCHEDULES

One-to-Many: Each room can be scheduled for multiple class sessions, but each schedule uses one specific room.

üí∞ Financial Module ERD Diagram

Financial ERD High Priority

Financial Module Entity Relationship Diagram

Student Financial Management Tables

üí∞ Financial Module Explanation

This ERD handles all financial aspects of student management including fee structures, payment processing, installment tracking, and scholarship management. The design supports flexible payment plans and comprehensive financial reporting across different programs and academic years.

  • üí≥ FEE_STRUCTURES: Program-specific fee definitions including tuition, miscellaneous fees, and semester-based pricing
  • üìã STUDENT_ASSESSMENTS: Individual student fee calculations with total amounts, balances, and payment status
  • üí∞ PAYMENTS: Payment transactions with multiple payment methods, reference numbers, and timestamps
  • üìù ASSESSMENT_DETAILS: Detailed breakdown of fees per student assessment with individual amounts and discounts
  • üìÖ PAYMENT_INSTALLMENTS: Flexible payment plan management with scheduled installments and due dates
  • üéì SCHOLARSHIPS: Student scholarship tracking with discount percentages and academic year coverage

This module provides comprehensive financial management with flexible payment options, automated fee calculations, and detailed financial reporting for both students and administrators.

üîó Financial Module Relationships
üìö ‚Üí üí≥ PROGRAMS to FEE_STRUCTURES

One-to-Many: Each program can have multiple fee structures for different academic years and semesters, enabling flexible pricing.

üë• ‚Üí üìã STUDENTS to STUDENT_ASSESSMENTS

One-to-Many: Each student can have multiple assessments for different academic periods, tracking their financial obligations.

üìã ‚Üí üí∞ STUDENT_ASSESSMENTS to PAYMENTS

One-to-Many: Each assessment can have multiple payment records, allowing partial payments and installment tracking.

üìã ‚Üí üìù STUDENT_ASSESSMENTS to ASSESSMENT_DETAILS

One-to-Many: Each assessment contains multiple detail records breaking down individual fees and applicable discounts.

üí≥ ‚Üí üìù FEE_STRUCTURES to ASSESSMENT_DETAILS

One-to-Many: Each fee structure can be referenced by multiple assessment details, enabling consistent fee application.

üìã ‚Üí üìÖ STUDENT_ASSESSMENTS to PAYMENT_INSTALLMENTS

One-to-Many: Each assessment can have multiple installment schedules, supporting flexible payment plans.

üë• ‚Üí üéì STUDENTS to SCHOLARSHIPS

One-to-Many: Each student can have multiple scholarship records for different academic years and scholarship types.

üèõÔ∏è Administrative Module ERD Diagram

Administrative ERD Medium Priority

Administrative Module Entity Relationship Diagram

Faculty, Staff, and Support Services Tables

üèõÔ∏è Administrative Module Explanation

This ERD manages faculty, staff, and support services including library management, medical records, and administrative functions. The design supports comprehensive human resource management and student support services across all campuses.

  • üë®‚Äçüè´ FACULTY: Faculty member records linked to users and departments with position and employment status
  • üè¢ DEPARTMENTS: Academic and administrative departments with campus-specific organization and leadership
  • üìö FACULTY_LOAD: Teaching assignments linking faculty to class schedules with workload tracking
  • üìö BOOKS: Library inventory management with campus-specific collections and availability
  • üìñ BOOK_LOANS: Student book borrowing system with due dates and return tracking
  • üè• MEDICAL_RECORDS: Student health records with medical history and emergency contact information
  • üìã MEDICAL_APPOINTMENTS: Health service scheduling and appointment management
  • üìù INCIDENTS: Campus incident reporting and management system
  • üìä REPORTS: Administrative reporting system for various campus operations

This module ensures comprehensive administrative management with efficient faculty workload tracking, library services, health management, and incident reporting across all campus locations.

üîó Administrative Module Relationships
üë®‚Äçüè´ ‚Üí üè¢ FACULTY to DEPARTMENTS

Many-to-One: Each faculty member belongs to one department, but each department can have multiple faculty members.

üë®‚Äçüè´ ‚Üí üìö FACULTY to FACULTY_LOAD

One-to-Many: Each faculty member can have multiple teaching loads across different semesters and academic years.

‚è∞ ‚Üí üìö CLASS_SCHEDULES to FACULTY_LOAD

One-to-One: Each class schedule is assigned to one faculty member, and each faculty load corresponds to one schedule.

üè¢ ‚Üí üìö CAMPUSES to BOOKS

One-to-Many: Each campus maintains its own library collection, with multiple books per campus.

üë• ‚Üí üìñ STUDENTS to BOOK_LOANS

One-to-Many: Each student can borrow multiple books, but each loan belongs to one student.

üìö ‚Üí üìñ BOOKS to BOOK_LOANS

One-to-Many: Each book can be loaned multiple times to different students over time.

üë• ‚Üí üè• STUDENTS to MEDICAL_RECORDS

One-to-One: Each student has one medical record, and each medical record belongs to one student.

üë• ‚Üí üìã STUDENTS to MEDICAL_APPOINTMENTS

One-to-Many: Each student can have multiple medical appointments, but each appointment belongs to one student.

üë• ‚Üí üìù STUDENTS to INCIDENTS

One-to-Many: Each student can be involved in multiple incidents, but each incident involves one student.

üîê Core System SQL Scripts

Core Schema Critical

Core Tables Creation Scripts

Database Schema Foundation

-- =============================================
-- Skolaris Multi-Campus RBAC Database Schema
-- Compatible with MySQL/Aurora and PostgreSQL
-- =============================================

-- 1. CAMPUSES TABLE
CREATE TABLE campuses (
    campus_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    campus_code VARCHAR(20) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    campus_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    address TEXT,
    phone VARCHAR(50),
    email VARCHAR(100),
    website VARCHAR(255),
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    INDEX idx_campus_code (campus_code),
    INDEX idx_campus_active (is_active)
);

-- 2. USERS TABLE
CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    campus_id INT NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR(150) UNIQUE,
    phone VARCHAR(50),
    student_id VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE,
    employee_number VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE,
    password_hash VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    full_name VARCHAR(150) NOT NULL,
    user_type ENUM('student', 'faculty', 'staff', 'parent', 'admin', 'alumni') NOT NULL,
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (campus_id) REFERENCES campuses(campus_id) ON DELETE RESTRICT,
    INDEX idx_user_email (email),
    INDEX idx_user_campus (campus_id),
    INDEX idx_user_type (user_type),
    INDEX idx_user_active (is_active),
    INDEX idx_user_employee_number (employee_number)
);

-- 3. ROLES TABLE
CREATE TABLE roles (
    role_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    role_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    role_level INT NOT NULL CHECK (role_level BETWEEN 1 AND 4),
    is_global BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    campus_id INT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (campus_id) REFERENCES campuses(campus_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    UNIQUE KEY uk_role_campus (role_name, campus_id),
    INDEX idx_role_level (role_level),
    INDEX idx_role_global (is_global)
);

-- 4. PERMISSIONS TABLE
CREATE TABLE permissions (
    permission_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    module VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    action VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    resource VARCHAR(100),
    description VARCHAR(255),
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    UNIQUE KEY uk_permission (module, action, resource),
    INDEX idx_permission_module (module)
);

-- 5. ROLE_PERMISSIONS TABLE
CREATE TABLE role_permissions (
    role_id INT,
    permission_id INT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    PRIMARY KEY (role_id, permission_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles(role_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (permission_id) REFERENCES permissions(permission_id) ON DELETE CASCADE
);

-- 6. USER_ROLES TABLE
CREATE TABLE user_roles (
    user_id BIGINT,
    role_id INT,
    campus_id INT,
    assigned_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id, campus_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles(role_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (campus_id) REFERENCES campuses(campus_id) ON DELETE CASCADE
);

-- 7. USER_SESSIONS TABLE
CREATE TABLE user_sessions (
    session_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    session_token VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    ip_address VARCHAR(45),
    user_agent TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    expires_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id) ON DELETE CASCADE
);

-- 8. AUDIT_LOGS TABLE
CREATE TABLE audit_logs (
    log_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id BIGINT,
    action VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    table_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    record_id VARCHAR(100),
    old_values JSON,
    new_values JSON,
    ip_address VARCHAR(45),
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id) ON DELETE SET NULL
);

-- Enhanced Module Management Tables
CREATE TABLE system_modules (
    module_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    parent_id INT NULL,
    module_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    module_code VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    display_name VARCHAR(150) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    icon VARCHAR(50),
    route_path VARCHAR(200),
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    sort_order INT DEFAULT 0,
    access_level ENUM('public', 'restricted', 'admin_only') DEFAULT 'restricted',
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (parent_id) REFERENCES system_modules(module_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    INDEX idx_parent_id (parent_id),
    INDEX idx_module_code (module_code),
    INDEX idx_is_active (is_active),
    INDEX idx_sort_order (sort_order)
);

CREATE TABLE role_module_access (
    access_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    role_id INT NOT NULL,
    module_id INT NOT NULL,
    can_view BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    can_create BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    can_edit BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    can_delete BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    can_export BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    can_import BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles(role_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (module_id) REFERENCES system_modules(module_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    UNIQUE KEY unique_role_module (role_id, module_id),
    INDEX idx_role_id (role_id),
    INDEX idx_module_id (module_id),
    INDEX idx_is_active (is_active)
);

-- =============================================
-- MIGRATION SCRIPT FOR EXISTING DATABASES
-- =============================================
-- Run this script to update existing databases to use consistent naming

-- Rename employee_id to employee_number in users table
ALTER TABLE users CHANGE COLUMN employee_id employee_number VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE;

-- Add index for employee_number if it doesn't exist
ALTER TABLE users ADD INDEX idx_user_employee_number (employee_number);

üéì Academic Module SQL Scripts

Academic Tables High

Academic Module Database Tables

Student Academic Management Tables

-- =============================================
-- ACADEMIC MODULE TABLES
-- =============================================

-- 1. STUDENTS TABLE
CREATE TABLE students (
    student_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    program_id INT NOT NULL,
    student_number VARCHAR(20) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    year_level INT NOT NULL CHECK (year_level BETWEEN 1 AND 6),
    status ENUM('active', 'inactive', 'graduated', 'dropped', 'transferred') DEFAULT 'active',
    admission_date DATE NOT NULL,
    expected_graduation DATE,
    gpa DECIMAL(3,2) DEFAULT 0.00,
    total_units_earned INT DEFAULT 0,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (program_id) REFERENCES programs(program_id) ON DELETE RESTRICT,
    INDEX idx_student_number (student_number),
    INDEX idx_student_program (program_id),
    INDEX idx_student_status (status)
);

-- 2. STUDENT_PERSONAL_INFORMATION TABLE
CREATE TABLE student_personal_information (
    personal_info_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    student_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    lrn VARCHAR(12) UNIQUE, -- Learner Reference Number (DepEd)
    dswd_household_no VARCHAR(20), -- DSWD Household Number (optional)
    birth_date DATE NOT NULL,
    birth_place VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    gender ENUM('male', 'female') NOT NULL,
    civil_status ENUM('single', 'married', 'widowed', 'separated', 'divorced') DEFAULT 'single',
    nationality VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'Filipino',
    religion VARCHAR(50),
    blood_type ENUM('A+', 'A-', 'B+', 'B-', 'AB+', 'AB-', 'O+', 'O-'),
    height_cm DECIMAL(5,2),
    weight_kg DECIMAL(5,2),
    disability_type VARCHAR(100),
    is_pwd BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE, -- Person with Disability
    is_4ps_beneficiary BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE, -- 4Ps Program beneficiary
    is_scholarship_recipient BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    scholarship_type VARCHAR(100),
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (student_id) REFERENCES students(student_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    INDEX idx_lrn (lrn),
    INDEX idx_dswd_household (dswd_household_no),
    INDEX idx_birth_date (birth_date),
    INDEX idx_gender (gender)
);

-- 3. STUDENT_EDUCATIONAL_BACKGROUND TABLE
CREATE TABLE student_educational_background (
    education_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    student_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    education_level ENUM('elementary', 'junior_high', 'senior_high', 'college', 'graduate') NOT NULL,
    school_name VARCHAR(200) NOT NULL,
    school_address TEXT,
    school_type ENUM('public', 'private', 'state_university', 'local_university') NOT NULL,
    year_graduated YEAR,
    year_started YEAR,
    strand VARCHAR(100), -- For Senior High School (STEM, ABM, HUMSS, GAS, TVL, etc.)
    track VARCHAR(50), -- Academic, Technical-Vocational-Livelihood, Sports, Arts and Design
    specialization VARCHAR(100), -- For TVL track
    gpa DECIMAL(3,2),
    honors_received VARCHAR(200),
    is_graduated BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (student_id) REFERENCES students(student_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    INDEX idx_education_level (education_level),
    INDEX idx_school_name (school_name),
    INDEX idx_year_graduated (year_graduated),
    INDEX idx_strand (strand)
);

-- 4. STUDENT_FAMILY_INFORMATION TABLE
CREATE TABLE student_family_information (
    family_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    student_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    father_name VARCHAR(150),
    father_occupation VARCHAR(100),
    father_employer VARCHAR(150),
    father_contact VARCHAR(20),
    father_education VARCHAR(100),
    mother_name VARCHAR(150),
    mother_occupation VARCHAR(100),
    mother_employer VARCHAR(150),
    mother_contact VARCHAR(20),
    mother_education VARCHAR(100),
    guardian_name VARCHAR(150),
    guardian_relationship VARCHAR(50),
    guardian_contact VARCHAR(20),
    guardian_address TEXT,
    family_income_range ENUM('below_10k', '10k_20k', '20k_30k', '30k_50k', '50k_100k', 'above_100k'),
    number_of_siblings INT DEFAULT 0,
    birth_order INT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (student_id) REFERENCES students(student_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    INDEX idx_father_name (father_name),
    INDEX idx_mother_name (mother_name),
    INDEX idx_guardian_name (guardian_name)
);

-- 5. STUDENT_ADDRESS_INFORMATION TABLE
CREATE TABLE student_address_information (
    address_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    student_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    address_type ENUM('permanent', 'present', 'provincial') NOT NULL,
    house_no VARCHAR(20),
    street VARCHAR(100),
    barangay VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    city_municipality VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    province VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    region VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    postal_code VARCHAR(10),
    country VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'Philippines',
    is_same_as_permanent BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (student_id) REFERENCES students(student_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    INDEX idx_address_type (address_type),
    INDEX idx_city_municipality (city_municipality),
    INDEX idx_province (province),
    INDEX idx_region (region)
);

-- 6. STUDENT_CONTACT_INFORMATION TABLE
CREATE TABLE student_contact_information (
    contact_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    student_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    contact_type ENUM('mobile', 'landline', 'email', 'facebook', 'telegram', 'viber') NOT NULL,
    contact_value VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    is_primary BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    is_emergency_contact BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    contact_person VARCHAR(150), -- For emergency contacts
    relationship VARCHAR(50), -- For emergency contacts
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (student_id) REFERENCES students(student_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    INDEX idx_contact_type (contact_type),
    INDEX idx_is_primary (is_primary),
    INDEX idx_is_emergency (is_emergency_contact)
);

-- 7. PROGRAMS TABLE
CREATE TABLE programs (
    program_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    campus_id INT NOT NULL,
    program_code VARCHAR(20) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    program_name VARCHAR(150) NOT NULL,
    degree_type ENUM('certificate', 'diploma', 'bachelor', 'master', 'doctorate') NOT NULL,
    duration_years DECIMAL(2,1) NOT NULL,
    total_units INT NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (campus_id) REFERENCES campuses(campus_id) ON DELETE RESTRICT,
    INDEX idx_program_code (program_code),
    INDEX idx_program_campus (campus_id)
);

-- 3. SUBJECTS TABLE
CREATE TABLE subjects (
    subject_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    subject_code VARCHAR(20) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    subject_name VARCHAR(150) NOT NULL,
    units INT NOT NULL CHECK (units BETWEEN 1 AND 6),
    type ENUM('lecture', 'laboratory', 'lecture_lab', 'practicum', 'thesis') NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    prerequisites TEXT,
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    INDEX idx_subject_code (subject_code),
    INDEX idx_subject_type (type)
);

-- 4. CURRICULUM TABLE
CREATE TABLE curriculum (
    curriculum_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    program_id INT NOT NULL,
    subject_id INT NOT NULL,
    year_level INT NOT NULL CHECK (year_level BETWEEN 1 AND 6),
    semester INT NOT NULL CHECK (semester BETWEEN 1 AND 3),
    is_required BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    prerequisites TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (program_id) REFERENCES programs(program_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (subject_id) REFERENCES subjects(subject_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    UNIQUE KEY uk_curriculum (program_id, subject_id, year_level, semester),
    INDEX idx_curriculum_program (program_id),
    INDEX idx_curriculum_year_sem (year_level, semester)
);

-- 5. SECTIONS TABLE
CREATE TABLE sections (
    section_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    program_id INT NOT NULL,
    section_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    year_level INT NOT NULL CHECK (year_level BETWEEN 1 AND 6),
    semester INT NOT NULL CHECK (semester BETWEEN 1 AND 3),
    school_year VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    max_students INT DEFAULT 40,
    current_students INT DEFAULT 0,
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (program_id) REFERENCES programs(program_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    UNIQUE KEY uk_section (program_id, section_name, school_year),
    INDEX idx_section_program (program_id),
    INDEX idx_section_year_sem (year_level, semester)
);

-- 6. STUDENT_SECTIONS TABLE (Junction table for many-to-many)
CREATE TABLE student_sections (
    student_id BIGINT,
    section_id INT,
    enrollment_date DATE NOT NULL,
    status ENUM('enrolled', 'dropped', 'completed') DEFAULT 'enrolled',
    final_grade DECIMAL(3,2),
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    PRIMARY KEY (student_id, section_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (student_id) REFERENCES students(student_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (section_id) REFERENCES sections(section_id) ON DELETE CASCADE
);

-- 7. ROOMS TABLE
CREATE TABLE rooms (
    room_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    campus_id INT NOT NULL,
    room_number VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    building VARCHAR(50),
    floor INT,
    capacity INT NOT NULL,
    type ENUM('classroom', 'laboratory', 'computer_lab', 'library', 'auditorium', 'gym') NOT NULL,
    equipment TEXT,
    is_available BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (campus_id) REFERENCES campuses(campus_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    UNIQUE KEY uk_room (campus_id, room_number),
    INDEX idx_room_type (type),
    INDEX idx_room_capacity (capacity)
);

-- 8. CLASS_SCHEDULES TABLE
CREATE TABLE class_schedules (
    schedule_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    section_id INT NOT NULL,
    subject_id INT NOT NULL,
    faculty_id INT,
    room_id INT NOT NULL,
    day_of_week ENUM('Monday', 'Tuesday', 'Wednesday', 'Thursday', 'Friday', 'Saturday', 'Sunday') NOT NULL,
    time_start TIME NOT NULL,
    time_end TIME NOT NULL,
    school_year VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    semester INT NOT NULL CHECK (semester BETWEEN 1 AND 3),
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (section_id) REFERENCES sections(section_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (subject_id) REFERENCES subjects(subject_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (room_id) REFERENCES rooms(room_id) ON DELETE RESTRICT,
    INDEX idx_schedule_section (section_id),
    INDEX idx_schedule_day_time (day_of_week, time_start),
    INDEX idx_schedule_room (room_id)
);

-- 9. GRADE_COMPONENTS TABLE
CREATE TABLE grade_components (
    component_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    subject_id INT NOT NULL,
    component_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    percentage DECIMAL(5,2) NOT NULL CHECK (percentage > 0 AND percentage <= 100),
    component_type ENUM('quiz', 'exam', 'project', 'assignment', 'participation', 'attendance') NOT NULL,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (subject_id) REFERENCES subjects(subject_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    INDEX idx_component_subject (subject_id)
);

-- 10. STUDENT_GRADES TABLE
CREATE TABLE student_grades (
    grade_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    student_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    subject_id INT NOT NULL,
    section_id INT NOT NULL,
    faculty_id INT,
    prelim_grade DECIMAL(3,2),
    midterm_grade DECIMAL(3,2),
    final_grade DECIMAL(3,2),
    overall_grade DECIMAL(3,2),
    letter_grade CHAR(2),
    status ENUM('passed', 'failed', 'incomplete', 'dropped') DEFAULT 'incomplete',
    school_year VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    semester INT NOT NULL CHECK (semester BETWEEN 1 AND 3),
    remarks TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (student_id) REFERENCES students(student_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (subject_id) REFERENCES subjects(subject_id) ON DELETE RESTRICT,
    FOREIGN KEY (section_id) REFERENCES sections(section_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    UNIQUE KEY uk_student_grade (student_id, subject_id, school_year, semester),
    INDEX idx_grade_student (student_id),
    INDEX idx_grade_subject (subject_id),
    INDEX idx_grade_status (status)
);

-- 11. STUDENT_GRADE_COMPONENTS TABLE
CREATE TABLE student_grade_components (
    component_grade_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    grade_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    component_id INT NOT NULL,
    score DECIMAL(5,2),
    max_score DECIMAL(5,2),
    percentage_score DECIMAL(5,2),
    date_recorded DATE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (grade_id) REFERENCES student_grades(grade_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (component_id) REFERENCES grade_components(component_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    UNIQUE KEY uk_component_grade (grade_id, component_id),
    INDEX idx_component_grade_date (date_recorded)
);

-- 12. TRANSCRIPTS TABLE
CREATE TABLE transcripts (
    transcript_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    student_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    school_year VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    semester INT NOT NULL CHECK (semester BETWEEN 1 AND 3),
    year_level INT NOT NULL CHECK (year_level BETWEEN 1 AND 6),
    semester_gpa DECIMAL(3,2) DEFAULT 0.00,
    cumulative_gpa DECIMAL(3,2) DEFAULT 0.00,
    total_units_taken INT DEFAULT 0,
    total_units_earned INT DEFAULT 0,
    academic_standing ENUM('good_standing', 'probation', 'dean_list', 'president_list') DEFAULT 'good_standing',
    is_official BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    generated_date DATE,
    generated_by BIGINT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (student_id) REFERENCES students(student_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    UNIQUE KEY uk_transcript (student_id, school_year, semester),
    INDEX idx_transcript_student (student_id),
    INDEX idx_transcript_gpa (cumulative_gpa)
);

üí∞ Financial Module SQL Scripts

Financial Tables High

Financial Module Database Tables

Student Financial Management Tables

-- =============================================
-- FINANCIAL MODULE TABLES
-- =============================================

-- 1. FEE_STRUCTURES TABLE
CREATE TABLE fee_structures (
    fee_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    program_id INT NOT NULL,
    fee_type ENUM('tuition', 'miscellaneous', 'laboratory', 'library', 'registration', 'graduation', 'id_card', 'medical', 'insurance') NOT NULL,
    fee_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    amount DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL CHECK (amount >= 0),
    semester INT CHECK (semester BETWEEN 1 AND 3),
    school_year VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    year_level INT CHECK (year_level BETWEEN 1 AND 6),
    is_required BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (program_id) REFERENCES programs(program_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    INDEX idx_fee_program (program_id),
    INDEX idx_fee_type (fee_type),
    INDEX idx_fee_school_year (school_year)
);

-- 2. STUDENT_ASSESSMENTS TABLE
CREATE TABLE student_assessments (
    assessment_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    student_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    school_year VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    semester INT NOT NULL CHECK (semester BETWEEN 1 AND 3),
    total_amount DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL CHECK (total_amount >= 0),
    discount_amount DECIMAL(10,2) DEFAULT 0.00,
    net_amount DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL CHECK (net_amount >= 0),
    amount_paid DECIMAL(10,2) DEFAULT 0.00,
    balance DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL CHECK (balance >= 0),
    due_date DATE NOT NULL,
    status ENUM('pending', 'partial', 'paid', 'overdue', 'cancelled') DEFAULT 'pending',
    payment_terms ENUM('full_payment', 'installment_2', 'installment_3', 'installment_4') DEFAULT 'full_payment',
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (student_id) REFERENCES students(student_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    UNIQUE KEY uk_assessment (student_id, school_year, semester),
    INDEX idx_assessment_status (status),
    INDEX idx_assessment_due_date (due_date),
    INDEX idx_assessment_balance (balance)
);

-- 3. ASSESSMENT_DETAILS TABLE
CREATE TABLE assessment_details (
    detail_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    assessment_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    fee_id INT NOT NULL,
    quantity INT DEFAULT 1,
    unit_amount DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
    total_amount DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
    discount_amount DECIMAL(10,2) DEFAULT 0.00,
    net_amount DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (assessment_id) REFERENCES student_assessments(assessment_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (fee_id) REFERENCES fee_structures(fee_id) ON DELETE RESTRICT,
    INDEX idx_detail_assessment (assessment_id),
    INDEX idx_detail_fee (fee_id)
);

-- 4. PAYMENT_INSTALLMENTS TABLE
CREATE TABLE payment_installments (
    installment_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    assessment_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    installment_number INT NOT NULL CHECK (installment_number BETWEEN 1 AND 4),
    amount DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL CHECK (amount >= 0),
    due_date DATE NOT NULL,
    amount_paid DECIMAL(10,2) DEFAULT 0.00,
    balance DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
    status ENUM('pending', 'paid', 'overdue', 'waived') DEFAULT 'pending',
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (assessment_id) REFERENCES student_assessments(assessment_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    UNIQUE KEY uk_installment (assessment_id, installment_number),
    INDEX idx_installment_due_date (due_date),
    INDEX idx_installment_status (status)
);

-- 5. PAYMENTS TABLE
CREATE TABLE payments (
    payment_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    assessment_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    installment_id BIGINT,
    amount DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL CHECK (amount > 0),
    payment_date DATETIME NOT NULL,
    payment_method ENUM('cash', 'check', 'bank_transfer', 'credit_card', 'debit_card', 'gcash', 'paymaya', 'online_banking') NOT NULL,
    reference_number VARCHAR(100),
    bank_name VARCHAR(100),
    check_number VARCHAR(50),
    check_date DATE,
    received_by BIGINT,
    receipt_number VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE,
    remarks TEXT,
    status ENUM('pending', 'confirmed', 'bounced', 'cancelled') DEFAULT 'confirmed',
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (assessment_id) REFERENCES student_assessments(assessment_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (installment_id) REFERENCES payment_installments(installment_id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (received_by) REFERENCES users(user_id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    INDEX idx_payment_assessment (assessment_id),
    INDEX idx_payment_date (payment_date),
    INDEX idx_payment_method (payment_method),
    INDEX idx_payment_receipt (receipt_number)
);

-- 6. SCHOLARSHIPS TABLE
CREATE TABLE scholarships (
    scholarship_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    student_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    scholarship_type ENUM('academic', 'athletic', 'need_based', 'merit', 'government', 'private', 'employee_dependent') NOT NULL,
    scholarship_name VARCHAR(150) NOT NULL,
    sponsor_name VARCHAR(150),
    discount_type ENUM('percentage', 'fixed_amount') NOT NULL,
    discount_value DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL CHECK (discount_value >= 0),
    max_discount_amount DECIMAL(10,2),
    applicable_fees TEXT, -- JSON array of fee types
    academic_year_start VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    academic_year_end VARCHAR(20),
    semester_start INT CHECK (semester_start BETWEEN 1 AND 3),
    semester_end INT CHECK (semester_end BETWEEN 1 AND 3),
    gpa_requirement DECIMAL(3,2),
    status ENUM('active', 'suspended', 'completed', 'cancelled') DEFAULT 'active',
    conditions TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (student_id) REFERENCES students(student_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    INDEX idx_scholarship_student (student_id),
    INDEX idx_scholarship_type (scholarship_type),
    INDEX idx_scholarship_status (status),
    INDEX idx_scholarship_year (academic_year_start)
);

üèõÔ∏è Administrative Module SQL Scripts

Administrative Tables Medium

Administrative Module Database Tables

Faculty, Staff, and Support Services Tables

-- =============================================
-- ADMINISTRATIVE MODULE TABLES
-- =============================================

-- 1. DEPARTMENTS TABLE
CREATE TABLE departments (
    department_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    campus_id INT NOT NULL,
    department_code VARCHAR(20) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    department_name VARCHAR(150) NOT NULL,
    head_faculty_id INT,
    budget_allocation DECIMAL(12,2) DEFAULT 0.00,
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (campus_id) REFERENCES campuses(campus_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    INDEX idx_department_code (department_code),
    INDEX idx_department_campus (campus_id)
);

-- 2. FACULTY TABLE
CREATE TABLE faculty (
    faculty_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    department_id INT NOT NULL,
    employee_number VARCHAR(20) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    position ENUM('instructor', 'assistant_professor', 'associate_professor', 'professor', 'department_head', 'dean') NOT NULL,
    employment_type ENUM('full_time', 'part_time', 'contractual', 'visiting') NOT NULL,
    specialization TEXT,
    education_background TEXT,
    hire_date DATE NOT NULL,
    salary DECIMAL(10,2),
    status ENUM('active', 'inactive', 'on_leave', 'terminated') DEFAULT 'active',
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (department_id) REFERENCES departments(department_id) ON DELETE RESTRICT,
    INDEX idx_faculty_employee (employee_number),
    INDEX idx_faculty_department (department_id),
    INDEX idx_faculty_status (status)
);

-- Add foreign key constraint for department head
ALTER TABLE departments ADD CONSTRAINT fk_dept_head 
FOREIGN KEY (head_faculty_id) REFERENCES faculty(faculty_id) ON DELETE SET NULL;

-- 3. FACULTY_LOAD TABLE
CREATE TABLE faculty_load (
    load_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    faculty_id INT NOT NULL,
    schedule_id INT NOT NULL,
    school_year VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    semester INT NOT NULL CHECK (semester BETWEEN 1 AND 3),
    units DECIMAL(3,1) NOT NULL CHECK (units > 0),
    load_type ENUM('regular', 'overload', 'summer') DEFAULT 'regular',
    status ENUM('assigned', 'confirmed', 'cancelled') DEFAULT 'assigned',
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (faculty_id) REFERENCES faculty(faculty_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (schedule_id) REFERENCES class_schedules(schedule_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    UNIQUE KEY uk_faculty_schedule (faculty_id, schedule_id, school_year, semester),
    INDEX idx_load_faculty (faculty_id),
    INDEX idx_load_semester (school_year, semester)
);

-- 4. ATTENDANCE_RECORDS TABLE
CREATE TABLE attendance_records (
    attendance_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    student_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    schedule_id INT NOT NULL,
    attendance_date DATE NOT NULL,
    time_in TIME,
    time_out TIME,
    status ENUM('present', 'absent', 'late', 'excused') NOT NULL,
    remarks TEXT,
    recorded_by BIGINT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (student_id) REFERENCES students(student_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (schedule_id) REFERENCES class_schedules(schedule_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (recorded_by) REFERENCES users(user_id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    UNIQUE KEY uk_attendance (student_id, schedule_id, attendance_date),
    INDEX idx_attendance_date (attendance_date),
    INDEX idx_attendance_status (status)
);

-- 5. BOOKS TABLE (Library Management)
CREATE TABLE books (
    book_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    campus_id INT NOT NULL,
    isbn VARCHAR(20) UNIQUE,
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    author VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    publisher VARCHAR(150),
    publication_year YEAR,
    category VARCHAR(100),
    subject_area VARCHAR(100),
    copies_total INT NOT NULL DEFAULT 1,
    copies_available INT NOT NULL DEFAULT 1,
    location VARCHAR(100),
    acquisition_date DATE,
    price DECIMAL(8,2),
    status ENUM('available', 'damaged', 'lost', 'withdrawn') DEFAULT 'available',
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (campus_id) REFERENCES campuses(campus_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    INDEX idx_book_isbn (isbn),
    INDEX idx_book_title (title),
    INDEX idx_book_category (category),
    INDEX idx_book_status (status)
);

-- 6. BOOK_BORROWS TABLE
CREATE TABLE book_borrows (
    borrow_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    student_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    book_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    borrow_date DATE NOT NULL,
    due_date DATE NOT NULL,
    return_date DATE,
    returned_condition ENUM('good', 'damaged', 'lost'),
    fine_amount DECIMAL(8,2) DEFAULT 0.00,
    fine_paid BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    status ENUM('borrowed', 'returned', 'overdue', 'lost') DEFAULT 'borrowed',
    processed_by BIGINT,
    returned_by BIGINT,
    remarks TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (student_id) REFERENCES students(student_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (book_id) REFERENCES books(book_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (processed_by) REFERENCES users(user_id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (returned_by) REFERENCES users(user_id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    INDEX idx_borrow_student (student_id),
    INDEX idx_borrow_book (book_id),
    INDEX idx_borrow_date (borrow_date),
    INDEX idx_borrow_status (status)
);

-- 7. MEDICAL_RECORDS TABLE
CREATE TABLE medical_records (
    record_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    student_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    record_type ENUM('physical_exam', 'dental_exam', 'drug_test', 'vaccination', 'medical_certificate', 'health_clearance') NOT NULL,
    record_date DATE NOT NULL,
    expiry_date DATE,
    result ENUM('passed', 'failed', 'pending', 'requires_follow_up'),
    findings TEXT,
    recommendations TEXT,
    attending_physician VARCHAR(150),
    medical_facility VARCHAR(150),
    certificate_number VARCHAR(100),
    status ENUM('active', 'expired', 'revoked') DEFAULT 'active',
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (student_id) REFERENCES students(student_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    INDEX idx_medical_student (student_id),
    INDEX idx_medical_type (record_type),
    INDEX idx_medical_date (record_date),
    INDEX idx_medical_status (status)
);

-- 8. HEALTH_REQUIREMENTS TABLE
CREATE TABLE health_requirements (
    requirement_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    program_id INT NOT NULL,
    requirement_name VARCHAR(150) NOT NULL,
    record_type ENUM('physical_exam', 'dental_exam', 'drug_test', 'vaccination', 'medical_certificate', 'health_clearance') NOT NULL,
    is_required BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    validity_months INT DEFAULT 12,
    description TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (program_id) REFERENCES programs(program_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    INDEX idx_health_req_program (program_id)
);

-- 9. STUDENT_HEALTH_STATUS TABLE
CREATE TABLE student_health_status (
    status_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    student_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    requirement_id INT NOT NULL,
    record_id BIGINT,
    status ENUM('compliant', 'non_compliant', 'pending', 'expired') DEFAULT 'pending',
    compliance_date DATE,
    expiry_date DATE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (student_id) REFERENCES students(student_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (requirement_id) REFERENCES health_requirements(requirement_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (record_id) REFERENCES medical_records(record_id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    UNIQUE KEY uk_student_health_req (student_id, requirement_id),
    INDEX idx_health_status_student (student_id),
    INDEX idx_health_status_compliance (status)
);

-- 10. CLEARANCE_REQUIREMENTS TABLE
CREATE TABLE clearance_requirements (
    clearance_req_id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    program_id INT NOT NULL,
    department VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    requirement_name VARCHAR(150) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    is_required BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    sort_order INT DEFAULT 0,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (program_id) REFERENCES programs(program_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    INDEX idx_clearance_req_program (program_id)
);

-- 11. STUDENT_CLEARANCES TABLE
CREATE TABLE student_clearances (
    clearance_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    student_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    clearance_req_id INT NOT NULL,
    status ENUM('pending', 'cleared', 'hold', 'not_applicable') DEFAULT 'pending',
    cleared_date DATE,
    cleared_by BIGINT,
    hold_reason TEXT,
    remarks TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (student_id) REFERENCES students(student_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (clearance_req_id) REFERENCES clearance_requirements(clearance_req_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (cleared_by) REFERENCES users(user_id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    UNIQUE KEY uk_student_clearance (student_id, clearance_req_id),
    INDEX idx_clearance_student (student_id),
    INDEX idx_clearance_status (status)
);

-- 12. GRADUATION_APPLICATIONS TABLE
CREATE TABLE graduation_applications (
    application_id BIGINT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    student_id BIGINT NOT NULL,
    application_date DATE NOT NULL,
    expected_graduation_date DATE NOT NULL,
    graduation_ceremony_date DATE,
    diploma_type ENUM('original', 'certified_copy') DEFAULT 'original',
    total_units_required INT NOT NULL,
    total_units_completed INT NOT NULL,
    gpa DECIMAL(3,2) NOT NULL,
    latin_honor ENUM('summa_cum_laude', 'magna_cum_laude', 'cum_laude', 'none') DEFAULT 'none',
    clearance_status ENUM('pending', 'cleared', 'hold') DEFAULT 'pending',
    application_status ENUM('submitted', 'under_review', 'approved', 'rejected', 'graduated') DEFAULT 'submitted',
    reviewed_by BIGINT,
    review_date DATE,
    review_remarks TEXT,
    graduation_date DATE,
    diploma_number VARCHAR(50),
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (student_id) REFERENCES students(student_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (reviewed_by) REFERENCES users(user_id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    INDEX idx_graduation_student (student_id),
    INDEX idx_graduation_status (application_status),
    INDEX idx_graduation_date (expected_graduation_date)
);

INSERT INTO system_modules (module_id, parent_id, module_name, module_code, display_name, description, icon, route_path, is_active, sort_order, access_level) VALUES
-- Core System Modules

üë®‚Äçüéì Student Portal Capabilities

  • Academic Records: View grades, GPA, transcript, academic standing
  • Financial: View assessment, payment history, outstanding balance
  • Schedule: View class schedule, room assignments, faculty information
  • Library: Search books, view borrowing history, check due dates
  • Clearance: Check graduation requirements, clearance status
  • Profile: Update personal information, emergency contacts

üë®‚Äçüè´ Faculty Portal Capabilities

  • Class Management: View assigned classes, student roster, attendance
  • Grade Management: Enter grades, view grade distribution, generate reports
  • Schedule: View teaching schedule, room assignments, time conflicts
  • Student Records: Access student academic information, disciplinary records
  • Curriculum: View curriculum, subject prerequisites, learning outcomes
  • Communication: Send announcements, messages to students
  • Reports: Generate class performance reports, attendance reports

üèõÔ∏è Registrar Portal Capabilities

üé® Design System Guidelines

üé® Color Palette

  • Primary Blue: #667eea (Main brand color)
  • Secondary Green: #28a745 (Success, positive actions)
  • Warning Yellow: #ffc107 (Warnings, attention)
  • Error Red: #dc3545 (Errors, critical actions)
  • Info Cyan: #17a2b8 (Information, neutral actions)
  • Neutral Gray: #6c757d (Text, borders, backgrounds)

üìù Typography

  • Primary Font: Inter (Clean, modern, highly readable)
  • Monospace: Monaco (Code, data, technical content)
  • Heading Sizes: 2.5rem, 2rem, 1.5rem, 1.25rem, 1rem
  • Body Text: 1rem (16px) with 1.6 line height
  • Small Text: 0.875rem (14px) for captions
  • Font Weights: 400 (regular), 600 (semi-bold), 700 (bold)

üìê Spacing & Layout

  • Grid System: 12-column responsive grid
  • Breakpoints: Mobile (768px), Tablet (1024px), Desktop (1200px)
  • Spacing Scale: 4px, 8px, 16px, 24px, 32px, 48px, 64px
  • Container Max-width: 1200px with auto margins
  • Card Padding: 20px-25px for content cards
  • Button Padding: 12px 24px for primary buttons

üîò Component Guidelines

  • Buttons: Rounded corners (8px), proper hover states
  • Form Inputs: 12px padding, 8px border radius
  • Cards: 12px border radius, subtle shadows
  • Icons: 24px default size, consistent stroke width
  • Loading States: Skeleton screens, progress indicators
  • Error States: Clear error messages, validation feedback

‚ôø Accessibility

  • WCAG 2.1 AA: Full compliance for inclusive design
  • Color Contrast: Minimum 4.5:1 ratio for text
  • Keyboard Navigation: Full keyboard accessibility
  • Screen Readers: Proper ARIA labels and roles
  • Focus Indicators: Clear focus states for all interactive elements
  • Alt Text: Descriptive alt text for all images

üì± Responsive Design

  • Mobile First: Design for mobile, enhance for larger screens
  • Touch Targets: Minimum 44px for touch interactions
  • Flexible Layouts: CSS Grid and Flexbox for responsive design
  • Image Optimization: Responsive images with proper sizing
  • Performance: Optimized for fast loading on mobile networks
  • Progressive Enhancement: Core functionality works without JavaScript

üîí Security & Access Control

üõ°Ô∏è Enhanced Security Framework with Module-Based Access Control

SKOLARIS implements a comprehensive security framework with hierarchical module management, role-based access control, and granular permissions. The system ensures data protection, user privacy, and secure operations across all campuses.

8
Security Layers
45+
Module Permissions
6
Access Levels
256-bit
AES Encryption

üèóÔ∏è Module-Based Access Control System

Security Core Critical

Hierarchical Module Permission System

Advanced Role-Based Access with Module-Level Granularity

üéØ Enhanced RBAC Features
üå≥ Hierarchical Module Structure
  • Parent Modules: 12 main system categories
  • Sub-modules: 47+ specific feature modules
  • Inheritance: Parent permissions cascade to children
  • Override: Child-specific permission overrides
  • Dynamic Control: Enable/disable modules in real-time
üîê Granular Permissions
  • View: Read-only access to module data
  • Create: Add new records and entries
  • Edit: Modify existing data
  • Delete: Remove records (with audit trail)
  • Export: Generate reports and data exports
  • Import: Bulk data import capabilities
üõ°Ô∏è Access Levels
  • Public: Accessible to all authenticated users
  • Restricted: Role-based access required
  • Admin Only: Super admin and campus admin access
  • Campus Specific: Campus-level restrictions
  • Department Level: Department-based access
  • Personal Only: User's own data access

üîí Security Implementation

üîê Authentication & Authorization

  • Multi-Factor Authentication: SMS, Email, TOTP support
  • JWT Tokens: Secure, stateless authentication
  • Session Management: Automatic timeout and renewal
  • Password Policy: Complexity requirements and expiration
  • Account Lockout: Brute force protection
  • Single Sign-On: Campus-wide authentication

üõ°Ô∏è Data Protection

  • Encryption at Rest: AES-256 database encryption
  • Encryption in Transit: TLS 1.3 for all communications
  • Data Masking: Sensitive data protection
  • Backup Encryption: Encrypted backup storage
  • Key Management: Secure key rotation and storage
  • GDPR Compliance: Data privacy and right to deletion

üìä Security Monitoring

  • Audit Logging: Comprehensive activity tracking
  • Real-time Monitoring: Suspicious activity detection
  • Security Alerts: Automated threat notifications
  • Access Analytics: User behavior analysis
  • Compliance Reporting: Security compliance reports
  • Incident Response: Automated security responses

üåê Network Security

  • Firewall Protection: Application-level firewall
  • DDoS Protection: Distributed attack mitigation
  • IP Whitelisting: Restricted access by location
  • VPN Support: Secure remote access
  • Rate Limiting: API abuse prevention
  • CORS Policy: Cross-origin request security

üîó Key Relationships Explained:
  • Module Hierarchy: SYSTEM_MODULES has self-referencing parent_id for hierarchical structure

  • Academic Flow: STUDENTS ‚Üí PROGRAMS ‚Üí SUBJECTS ‚Üí CLASS_SCHEDULES ‚Üí STUDENT_GRADES
  • Financial Flow: FEE_STRUCTURES ‚Üí STUDENT_ASSESSMENTS ‚Üí PAYMENTS

Legend: CRUD+ = Full Access (Create, Read, Update, Delete, Export, Import) CRU = Limited (Create, Read, Update) R+E = Read + Export R = Read Only ‚Äî = No Access

üîê Connect Your Trello Account

To add, edit, or delete comments, please connect your personal Trello account. This ensures comments appear with your name.

How it works:
1. Click "Connect Trello Account" below
2. A popup will open to Trello's authorization page
3. Log in with your Trello account and click "Allow"
4. If automatic connection works, you're done! If not, you may need to copy/paste the token.
‚úÖ Authorization Complete!

Next step: Please paste your Trello token below to complete the connection.

üí° How to get your token (click to expand)
1. After clicking "Allow" in the Trello popup, you should see a token on the page
2. Copy the entire token (it starts with "ATTA" and is quite long)
3. Paste it in the field above
4. Click "Connect" to complete the setup

üîó Connect Your Trello Account

üîê Connect Your Trello Account

To add, edit, or delete comments, please connect your personal Trello account. This ensures comments appear with your name and enables full collaboration features.

How it works:
1. Click "Connect Trello Account" below
2. A popup will open to Trello's authorization page
3. Log in with your Trello account and click "Allow"
4. If automatic connection works, you're done! If not, you may need to copy/paste the token.
‚úÖ Authorization Complete!

Next step: Please paste your Trello token below to complete the connection.

üîç How to get your Trello token:

Step 1: After clicking "Connect Trello Account", you'll be redirected to Trello's authorization page.

Step 2: Log in to your Trello account and click "Allow" to grant access.

Step 3: You'll see a page with a long token (starts with "ATTA..."). Copy this entire token.

Step 4: Paste the token in the text area above and click "Complete Connection".

‚ö†Ô∏è Security Note: This token gives access to your Trello account. Only use it with trusted applications.
